result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank D Lay Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay a fine of $25.00 PLUS all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges. To be paid by 04-19-2017 or serve 10 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.

***Court MAY consider expungement upon successful completion of the sentence***

With credit for 7 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITON
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
10 days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Sentencing hearing proceeded.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 7 DAYS: TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
The Court ordered the defendant to  Pay a FINE OF- $ 25.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges  Balance to be paid by 4-19-2017 or serve 10 days in the House of Corrections consective to any other sentence.

NOTE:  
Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.
The Court may consider Expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense request time to accumulate funds towards restitution.  Court is in jury trial on another matter.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered stayed bench warrant cancelled.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 2-3-16 AT 1:30 IN BRANCH 47. LR  Calendar call scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Defendant Frank D Lay in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lamke in intake screening.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch  47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frank D Lay in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Frank D Lay in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
